Code Documentation

This section contains automatically generated documentation from the source code docstrings.

News App

The main Django app containing models, views, and utilities for the news management system.

Models

class news.models.Article(*args, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: Model

Django model representing a news article in the system.

Articles have a submission and approval workflow, where journalists submit articles that must be approved by editors before publication.

Parameters:

  • title (str) – Article headline/title

  • content (str) – Full article text content

  • author (CustomUser) – Journalist who wrote the article

  • publisher (Publisher) – Publisher organization (optional)

  • status (str) – Current review status (submitted/approved/rejected)

  • created_at (datetime) – When article was first created

  • updated_at (datetime) – Last modification timestamp

exception DoesNotExist

Bases: ObjectDoesNotExist

exception MultipleObjectsReturned

Bases: MultipleObjectsReturned

STATUS_CHOICES = [('submitted', 'Submitted for Review'), ('approved', 'Approved'), ('rejected', 'Rejected')]

class news.models.CustomUser(*args, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: AbstractUser

Extended Django user model with role-based functionality.

Supports three user roles: reader, editor, and journalist, each with specific permissions and relationships to publishers and other users.

Parameters:

  • role (str) – User role (reader, editor, or journalist)

  • subscribed_publishers (ManyToManyField) – Publishers user subscribes to

  • subscribed_journalists (ManyToManyField) – Journalists user follows

  • publishers (ManyToManyField) – Publishers where user works (staff only)

exception DoesNotExist

Bases: ObjectDoesNotExist

exception MultipleObjectsReturned

Bases: MultipleObjectsReturned

ROLE_CHOICES = [('reader', 'Reader'), ('editor', 'Editor'), ('journalist', 'Journalist')]
approved_articles

Accessor to the related objects manager on the reverse side of a many-to-one relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

Parent.children is a ReverseManyToOneDescriptor instance.

Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager class built by create_forward_many_to_many_manager() defined below.

assign_to_group()[source]

Assign user to the appropriate Django group based on their role.

Removes user from existing groups and adds them to the role-specific group, creating the group if it doesn’t exist.

Pizza.toppings and Topping.pizzas are ManyToManyDescriptor instances.

save(*args, **kwargs)[source]

Override Django’s save method to handle role-based assignments.

Manages appropriate field clearing based on user role and automatically assigns users to correct permission groups.

Parameters:

  • args – Positional arguments passed to parent save method

  • kwargs – Keyword arguments passed to parent save method

set_group_permissions(group, role)[source]

Configure permissions for a role-based group.

Sets appropriate Django permissions for each user role type, controlling access to article creation, editing, and approval.

Parameters:

  • group (Group) – Django group to configure permissions for

  • role (str) – User role (reader, editor, or journalist)

class news.models.Publisher(*args, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: Model

Django model representing a publisher organization.

A publisher can have multiple editors and journalists associated with it. Readers can subscribe to publishers to receive notifications about new articles.

Parameters:

  • name (str) – The unique name of the publisher

  • description (str) – Description of the publisher

Views

news.views.approve_article(request, article_id)[source]

Approve or reject an article (editors only).

news.views.article_detail(request, article_id)[source]

View to display details of a specific article.

news.views.article_list(request)[source]

List articles based on user role and permissions.

news.views.create_article(request)[source]

Handle article creation by journalists.

Allows authenticated journalists to create new articles for submission. Handles form validation and saves articles with ‘submitted’ status.

Parameters:

request (HttpRequest) – Django HTTP request object

Returns:

Article creation form or redirect after successful creation

Return type:

HttpResponse

Raises:

PermissionDenied – If user is not a journalist

news.views.delete_article(request, article_id)[source]

Delete an article.

news.views.edit_article(request, article_id)[source]

Edit an existing article.

news.views.home(request)[source]

Display the home page with recent approved articles.

Shows the 6 most recently published articles for all users. Uses the home.html template to render the content.

Parameters:

request (HttpRequest) – Django HTTP request object

Returns:

Rendered home page with recent articles

Return type:

HttpResponse

news.views.journalist_list(request)[source]

List all journalists for subscription purposes (readers only).

news.views.login_user(request)[source]

Handle user authentication and login process.

Validates username and password, authenticates the user, and logs them in. Handles both GET (show form) and POST (process login) requests.

Parameters:

request (HttpRequest) – Django HTTP request object

Returns:

Login form or redirect to home after successful login

Return type:

HttpResponse

news.views.logout_user(request)[source]

Logout view for the news application.

news.views.my_subscriptions(request)[source]

View user’s journalist subscriptions (readers only). Publisher subscriptions are managed during registration only.

news.views.register(request)[source]

Handles user registration by verifying all fields and creating a new user.

news.views.send_article_approval_email(article)[source]

Send email notifications to subscribers when an article is approved.

Notifies users who are subscribed to either the article’s publisher or the journalist who authored the article.

Parameters:

article (Article) – The approved article instance

Returns:

None

Return type:

None

news.views.subscribe_to_journalist(request, journalist_id)[source]

Subscribe to a journalist’s articles (readers only).

news.views.unsubscribe_from_journalist(request, journalist_id)[source]

Unsubscribe from a journalist’s articles (readers only).

Forms

Django forms for the GrabDaNews application.

This module contains form classes for user registration, article creation, and other user interface interactions. Forms include validation and Bootstrap styling for consistent appearance.

class news.forms.ArticleForm(*args, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: ModelForm

Django ModelForm for creating and editing news articles.

Provides form fields for article title, content, and publisher selection. Includes Bootstrap styling and validation for journalist use.

Parameters:

  • model (Model) – Article model class

  • fields (list) – Form fields to include

clean()[source]

Hook for doing any extra form-wide cleaning after Field.clean() has been called on every field. Any ValidationError raised by this method will not be associated with a particular field; it will have a special-case association with the field named ‘__all__’.

declared_fields = {'email': <django.forms.fields.EmailField object>, 'first_name': <django.forms.fields.CharField object>, 'last_name': <django.forms.fields.CharField object>, 'password1': <django.forms.fields.CharField object>, 'password2': <django.forms.fields.CharField object>, 'publishers': <django.forms.models.ModelMultipleChoiceField object>, 'role': <django.forms.fields.ChoiceField object>}
property media

Return all media required to render the widgets on this form.

save(commit=True)[source]

Save this form’s self.instance object if commit=True. Otherwise, add a save_m2m() method to the form which can be called after the instance is saved manually at a later time. Return the model instance.

Utils

Utility functions for the GrabDaNews application.

This module contains helper functions for user validation, including username, password, email, and role verification.

news.utils.verify_email(email)[source]

Verify email format and uniqueness in the system.

Checks basic email format (contains @) and ensures email is not already registered by another user.

Parameters:

email (str) – Email address to validate

Returns:

True if email is valid and unique, False otherwise

Return type:

bool

news.utils.verify_password(password)[source]

Validate password strength and format requirements.

Checks that password meets minimum security requirements: - At least 8 characters long - Contains at least one digit - Contains at least one alphabetic character

Parameters:

password (str) – Password to validate

Returns:

True if password meets requirements, False otherwise

Return type:

bool

news.utils.verify_role_publisher(role, publisher_ids)[source]

Validate role and publisher relationship combinations.

Ensures that provided publisher IDs exist in the database and are valid for the given user role.

Parameters:

  • role (str) – User role being validated

  • publisher_ids (list) – List of publisher IDs to validate

Returns:

Tuple of (is_valid, error_message)

Return type:

tuple[bool, str]

news.utils.verify_username(username)[source]

Validate username availability and format.

Checks if username is provided and not already taken by another user.

Parameters:

username (str) – Username to validate

Returns:

True if username is valid and available, False otherwise

Return type:

bool

Twitter Integration

Twitter/X integration module for GrabDaNews application.

This module provides functionality for automatically posting tweets when articles are approved and published. It uses OAuth 1.0a authentication with Twitter API v2.

news.twitter_utils.send_tweet(text)[source]

Send a tweet using Twitter API v2 with OAuth 1.0a authentication.

Parameters:

text (str) – The text content of the tweet to be posted

Returns:

True if tweet was posted successfully, False otherwise

Return type:

bool

Raises:

Exception – If there’s an error with the API request

news.twitter_utils.tweet_article_approved(article)[source]

Post a tweet when a news article is approved and published.

Creates a formatted tweet containing article title, author name, and publisher information. Handles text truncation to stay within Twitter’s 280 character limit.

Parameters:

article (Article) – The Django model instance of the approved article

Returns:

True if tweet was posted successfully, False otherwise

Return type:

bool

API Views

API Views for the News application. Provides RESTful endpoints for articles, publishers, and journalists.

class news.api_views.ArticleListAPIView(**kwargs)[source]

Bases: BaseListView

get_queryset()[source]

Get the list of items for this view. This must be an iterable, and may be a queryset. Defaults to using self.queryset.

This method should always be used rather than accessing self.queryset directly, as self.queryset gets evaluated only once, and those results are cached for all subsequent requests.

You may want to override this if you need to provide different querysets depending on the incoming request.

(Eg. return a list of items that is specific to the user)
